column4: does anyone know how to automount a data partition in Feisty ?
you need to edit /etc/fstab. If you google for "fstab" you should be able to find some tutorials.
I just did that, under the help of a wannabe guru, and it didn't work
what did you add? Do you get any error messages when you try to mount it?
no, no error messages, but I wouldn't see it even in /mnt
so... you created a directory, e.g. /mnt/otherPartition, then you add a line to the fstab to tell the system to mount (eg) /dev/sda1 into /mnt/otherPartition?
no, I didn't create any directory; I just added a line in fstab
you need to create a directory into which you will mount the drive...
ok, sounds good, but mind the "newbie" part. Isn't there a GUI way of doing it ?
the first time I installed feisty it would automount both other partitions on boot.
there might be, but I'm not aware of it. I've always done it by editing fstab.
sounds like you've installed a bit of software which has edited your fstab. That does happen sometimes (though it's a bit naughty - software shouldn't do that without warning you of hte consequences)
well, that's the thing, it's a quasi fresh install I'm doing this on.

right, just to summarise: you need to tell the system to mount a partition device (//dev/sda5) into a directory (which can be anything, for instance /mnt/disk or /media/mount or whatever you like). You also need to make sure that that directory exists - if it doesn't, then create it. The line that hellblade quoted you for fstab should work - just copy it in and subsitute your chosen directory instead of /media/mountpoint
don't worry about UUIDs at all, by the way. That's a new thing that ubuntu uses but you can stilluse the old-fashioned "/dev/sda5"
slimey, thanks a bunch. I'm right now on the phone, i'll give this a try. Thans.
